page.title: 08VINEYARD AT HERONS GHYLL
page.content: Barnsgate Manor Vineyard was established here in l974 on South facing slopes where the acidic sandy loam is very suitable to growing vines 24 acres and some 25,000 vines con- sisting of 6 different types of grape are currently under cultivation. The wine is a dry to medium dry white and the Company averages 50-60,000 bottles annually which are exported to France, Germany and the Channel Islands or sold to caterers or direct to the public. The price of a bottle averages Â£3.95. The Vineyard is open to visitors. Guided tours, wine-tastings, wedding receptions etc. are catered for. The number of employees, all full time and mainly local varies according to the season from 6 to 30 and the executive manager is a specialist in viniculture.
